title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4830.16 - Rules of evidence
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4830.16 - Rules of evidence

State Regulations
(a) The rules of
evidence governing proceedings in the courts of the State shall not be rigidly
enforced in hearings before the commission, and unless objection is made and
duly noted in the stenographic record of a hearing, all evidence appearing in
the stenographic record shall be deemed to have been validly introduced for the
consideration of the commission. (b) The introduction of cumulative evidence
shall be avoided and the hearing officer may curtail the testimony of any
witness that the hearing officer judges to be merely cumulative; however, the
party offering such testimony may make a short avowal of the testimony that
would be given if the witness asserts that such avowal is true. This avowal
shall be made a part of the stenographic record. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

4830.16

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
